abstract.p: The landlord (chaudhri) Purshottam Das and record-keeper (qanungo) Paras Ram are updated about the ongoing actions against two outlaw warriors (girasiya) who have been harassing the peasants. They are further instructed to pay taxes and clear the tax arrears in district (pargana) Dhar.For more context on this document, see Munis Faruqui, The Princes of the Mughal Empire, p. 96.

div.p:
خطی که زبده الاقران چودهری پرسوتمداس و پرسرام قانونگوی
مشتمل بر حقیقت اکهی بهان و اودی سنگه گراسیه ها بجمعت همکن قریب سی سوار که
بحال رعایا مزاحمت می رساند و سواری نمودن رفعت پناه محمد عاقل و شجعات دستگاه
هرناته سنگه بچهار فوج و رسیدن خواجه نندلعل بر اودی سنگه گراسیه و بجهنم رسیدن
دو سوار از آن گراسیه و بکار آمدن چهار سوار از آن هرناته سنگه و اخبارات جوانب
و اطراف فرستاده بودید رسید مضمون معلوم گردید یقین که تا حال رفعت و اقبال پناه خان جیو
و شجعات دستگاه هرناته سنگه فکر گراسیه ها براصل نموده باشد و شما نیز درگشت سواری
دیه بدهی و تردد آن فرصت ندهند که مجرای خدمت بظهور آید و آنها چه وجود اند
و چه جمعیت دارند که مزاحمت بحال رعایا توانند رسانید از مقدمان دیه بدهی مچلکه بگیرد
که در رقبه هر کس عبور نماند و خبر نکند مجرم بکار گردد از این چنین تردد زود کشته خواهد شد
یا کناره می گیرند و نیز در باب توجیه شروع نمودن از اجناس مشنگ و کتان و تیله گرگیهون نشان می برند
نویشته بودید نیم مفهوم انجامید هرگاه که در سال گذشته آفت کلیه بود با وجود آن یازده هزار و سی صد روپیه
کژی زیاده مطابق نوشته عزت آثار خواجه بهاگمل کروری توجیه شده بود درین سال که بانعایت الهی و
اقبال لایزال والا زراعت فصل ربیع ایت یل خوب و بلا آفت است نه هزار روپیه
توجهی قرار داده اینمعنی چه دور از حساب است لایق آنکه نظر بر موجودات داشته و تخمیناً
دیه بدهی بی کم زیاده که بعد پرتال تفاوت ظاهر شود توجیه قرار دهند نوعی نماند که ستم
شریکی واقع نگردد و گردوآری مال سرکار فیض آثار بر وقت شود و تمام مدار فصل ربیع مذکور
بر جسن گندم و جو و کوکنار است مطابق موجودات بعمل خواهد آمد در این باب زیاده چه نوشته شود

The letter that the Eminent among Contemporaries Purshottam Das and Paras Ram qanungo had written
containing the facts about Akhai Bhan and Udai Singh, girasiyas [who] together with their body of companions [of] around thirty horsemen
had caused trouble to the peasants; and [about] the mounting [taking action] against them by the Exalted Refuge Muhammad Aqil and the Location of Bravery
Harnath Singh with four regiments; and [about] the arrival of Khwaja Nand Lal to the girasiya Udai Singh, and the arrival in hell of
two horsemen from that girasiya; and [about] the using up [death] of four horsemen of that Harnath Singh; and the news about the parts
and quarters [where] you had sent [searched] is received. By its contents you informed [us] that surely by now the Exalted and Glorious Refuge Khan JiuIn all likelihood, this refers to Muhammad Aqil.
and Location of Bravery Harnath Singh must have found the root of the problem of the girasiyas. And you too in patrolling
from village by village, and in those labours, do not give [them] any relief. Your responsibility should be obvious. [Find out] what the situation is, [and]
what gathering [forces] they have such that they can cause disturbance to the peasants. Take muchalkas from the muqaddams
that if somebody crosses their area and they do not inform, then they will be committing crimes. By such efforts they [the girasiyas] will be quickly killed
or set aside. And in the matter of commencing [of agriculture], out of the crops of mushang grains,Often glossed as an unspecified type of grain, mushang likely refers to a type of pea, either field peas or cowpeas. cotton, linseed, linseed oil, [and] wheat that were indicated,
[in what] you had written, [only] half were understood. Even though there was a calamity with the harvest in the past year, nevertheless 11,300 rupees
extra according to the writing of the honourable karori Khwaja Bhagmal had been assessed. In this year that by the blessing of God and
the endless prosperity of [his] majesty, the agriculture of the spring harvest of the dog year is good and without calamity. [However, only] 9,000 rupees
have been sent. What this means is hard to reckon. It is appropriate that paying attention to the present circumstances and by a
village-by-village appraisal, an assessment should be settled without the discrepancy of shortage or surplus that is exposed after an audit. Specifically, it should be shown that
[you] have not become a party to wrong-doing. And the collection of the taxes of the blessed government should be on time. And the complete focus of crops of the said harvest
[should be on] wheat and barley and opium. According to these circumstances, bring it to action. What more is there to write in this matter?

p.stamp: Round black ink seal Das, servant of Shah Buland Iqbal [in the year] 29 [or] 1066Since the document is otherwise undated, based on the year in the seal it was issued in or after 1066 Hijri, i.e. 1655–56 in the Gregorian calendar. Seals were often used for for years after they were issued, so it is possible this document was issued after this date, but most likely before Dara Shukoh's death in 1659.
